result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred judgment agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed. The defendant has not been convicted of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Montes-Rivera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Jesus Montes-Rivera in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty indicates she made the defendant an offer but was not sure if he was going to accept the offer.  Court questions the defendant.   Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend Count 1 to Possession of Controlled substance 961.41(3g)(b)  Plea of guilty to  Count 1.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court defers the finding of guilt on count 1 and orders 1 year probation with conditional discharge under 961.41 with conditions of court costs; $50.00 service of process fees and AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Court dismisses count 2.  15TR391  and 15TR392- defendant enters a plea of guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty of 15TR391 and orders $795.00 fine; $41.00 blood draw; 7 month DL revocation; AODA.  Court finds defendant guilty of 15TR392 and order $200.50 forfeiture.  Case No. 15TR578 is dismissed.  Court orders 15TR391 and 15TR392 to be paid at the rate of $100.00 a month beginning November 23, 2015.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt

Defendant Jesus Montes-Rivera in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant questions defendant regarding right to an attorney.  Defendant indicates that he would like an attorney. Court indicates that he must either have an attorney or the court will proceed with the plea and sentencing.   Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  - rt

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Jesus Montes-Rivera in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for a public defender.  Court enters a plea of not guilty on defendant's behalf.  Court sets bond of $500.00 signature; booking; no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription; no possession or consumption of alcohol; do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am. - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle wihout a valid driver's license.
